title: The Walking Dead season 10: Alpha and Beta clash as Whisperers get new recruit
text:
The Whisperers are in uprising but a new member of their pack could tear them apart in more ways than one in the teaser for next week’s Walking Dead.

We Are The End Of The World looks set to focus on the lives of the Whisperers once again, with the team beginning to divide amid the pressure of survival.

Focusing on Alpha (Samantha Morton) and Beta’s (Ryan Hurst) backstory, the pair are seen in an intense discussion as the brutish Beta runs a knife over Alpha’s bald head.

As Beta dominates over Alpha, he tells her: ‘We are far from the enemy, their fear will subside. It’s time that the pack returns.’

Giving her back her Whisperer mask (which, for the uninitiated, is made of human skin and hair so they look like a Walker…grim) it seems that the ruthless leader may have a new thorn in her side.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘The others have spoken of the life they saw,’ Beta continues. ‘She unsettles the pack.’

Alpha then assures: ‘There is clarity amid the chaos. Do you doubt me?’

‘Never,’ Beta shoots back.

Can Gamma be the undoing of the Whisperers? (Picture: AMC)

Amid their intense conversation, we see the initiation of a new member of the Whisperers – the introduction of Gamma (Thora Birch) to the team.

She was announced at San Diego Comic Con back in July, and described as a ‘Whisperer sentry fiercly protective of Alpha’.

But it appears that she could prove to be a chink in the armour of the unshakeable Alpha, whose previous scare tactics and demand for things her way resulted in 10 survivors dying with their heads beheaded and placed on pikes to send a message to the camp at Alexandria.

Speaking ahead of the new season, Samantha said: ‘In Season 10, I’m most excited for the fans to see Alpha’s humanity, and understanding a little bit more about what are the Whisperers, why they behave the way they behave.

More: The Walking Dead The Walking Dead's Norman Reedus wants Dog's real name to honour late brother The Walking Dead drops first look trailer for new spin-off series and it's everything The Walking Dead confirms Lauren Cohan’s Maggie will return for season 10

‘We’ve already seen this within the entire show, I think, but how the apocalypse affects some people one way and other people another way, and how primal instincts can take over individuals.’

‘Seeing more of that from a female perspective, as well, I think, is quite important,’ she continued. ‘With Alpha being this female villain, it’s interesting to explore.’

The Walking Dead airs Sundays on AMC in the US and Mondays on Fox in the UK.

description: Alpha (Samantha Morton) and Beta’s (Ryan Hurst) backstory is explored as The Whisperers initiate Gamma in The Walking Dead episode 2.
